column1: Isn't it overwhelmingly clear that the 1964 U.S. escalation in Vietnam was unjustified?
Given the U.S. missile deployments and blockade, isn't it obvious that the Soviets' 1962 missiles in Cuba were a justified response to American actions?
Isn't it painfully obvious that the 2003 U.S. invasion of Iraq lacked any adequate justification?
Isn't it clear beyond doubt that the U.S. use of atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in WWII was unnecessary?
Isn't it obvious that the 1983 U.S. invasion of Grenada lacked any legitimate justification?
Isn't it undeniable that the 1989 U.S. invasion of Panama was unjustified?
Isn't it unmistakably clear that the USAAF's 1945 bombing of Dresden lacked any genuine military justification?
